p: In conclusion, studies regarding the bioactivity potential of C. aurantium have revealed that flowers, fruits, essential oils, and phytoconstituents of this plant exerted several biological effects including antimicrobial, antioxidant, cytotoxic, anxiolytic, antidiabetic, antiobesity, and anti-inflammatory activities. However, further long-term studies are needed in order to affirm its safety, especially regarding the plant-drug interactions and the proper dosage. p-Synephrine is a very poor adrenergic agonist and, therefore, is not expected to produce cardiovascular effects. It should be noted that it is banned by the NCAA which was assumed without evidence that it possesses cardiovascular risks and potential toxicity. It is not banned by the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) which deals with Olympic athletes.
